Requirements:
Admission to the Respiratory Therapy Program's professional sequence is competitive and is not guaranteed by admission to The University of Akron. Students must meet the following minimum requirements to be considered for admission:

- Minimum 2.75 overall GPA.
- Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of 'C' or better (a 'C-' is not acceptable).
- Completion of a program application by the established deadline.
- Completion of a program specific interview.
- Submission of two letters of reference.
- Completion of 8 hours of clinical observation with a Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT).
- Successful completion of a background check, health records, immunizations, drug screen and physical exam.

Requirements:
The admission requirements for The University of Akron Accelerated BSN Program Option are:

- Baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college/university with an overall GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
- A GPA of 3.0 or higher in all prerequisite courses (no grade lower than a “C” accepted).
- Completion of all of the prerequisite courses prior to beginning the accelerated nursing program.
- Two recommendation forms.
- TEAS test minimum total score of 70%. The TEAS test may be taken a maximum of two times in a calendar year with at least 30 days between attempts. The higher of the two scores will be used.
- Written essay.
- A personal interview with School of Nursing faculty may be required.
- A completed application to The University of Akron as a transfer student.
- A completed application to The University of Akron School of Nursing.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (Accelerated)

Requirements: Admission to the LPN to BSN program option is competitive. To be considered for admission, applicants must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. In addition, students must have completed and passed both anatomy and physiology courses (with labs), chemistry, and English with a 'C' or better. Applicants must also hold an active LPN license in the state in which they will be completing their clinicals.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (for LPNs)
